subject: JUnit Ant task with batchtest is trying to run inner class as a test
msgSnippet: Hi, When I run my build script the last target is a JUnit task with a batchtest element:
messageBody:
Hi,
When I run my build script the last target is a JUnit task with a
batchtest element:

<target name="test" description="Execute the unit tests">
<junit fork="yes" forkmode="perBatch" haltonfailure="no"
printsummary="on" dir="${local.path}">
<classpath >
<path refid="project.runtime.classpath" />
</classpath>
<formatter type="xml" usefile="true"/>
<batchtest todir="${local.path}" >
<fileset dir="${server.path}/build/WEB-INF/classes">
<include name="test/**/*.class" />
</fileset>
</batchtest>
</junit>
</target>

This runs OK except when it gets to one of my JUnit test classes
which has inner classes;

public class AbstractConcurrentTaskConductorTest extends TestCase
{
private BaseTaskConductor conductor;
private class BaseTaskConductor extends
AbstractConcurrentTaskConductor{
public JComponent getView()
{
return null;
}

public void execute(Context context)
{
}

protected TaskEventListener getTaskListener()
{
return null;
}

protected Map<String, Task> getRunningTasks()
{
return super.getRunningTasks();
}
}

@Override
protected void setUp() throws Exception
{
super.setUp();
conductor = new BaseTaskConductor();
}


public void testGetRunningTasks(){
assertNotNull(conductor.getRunningTasks());
}
}

The actual trace I'm getting is:

junit.framework.AssertionFailedError:
Class
test.wellsfargo.svt.framework.AbstractConcurrentTaskConductorTest$1
has no
public constructor TestCase(String name) or TestCase()

So it seems as if the JUnit batchtest is trying to run the inner
class as if it's a Test - even though it isn't one.
When I run this test as a JUnit test from within the Eclipse IDE, it
executes fine so I presume there may be a bug in the JUnit Ant Task.
Can anyone tell me if this is the case and/or how to get around it?
Regards,
